content: The "Early Support for Families Act" establishes grants to states for quality home visitation programs for families with young children and families expecting children under the Social Security Act. The purpose of this section is to improve the well-being of children by establishing quality home visitation programs for families with young children and those expecting children. States seeking grants must submit an application describing these programs. The section aims to establish high-quality home visitation programs for families with young children and expecting families. States must provide a description of the programs, their intended outcomes, and evidence of effectiveness, as well as the results of a needs assessment on the number and quality of existing programs. The statewide needs assessment must describe the number, quality, and capacity of home visitation programs for families with young children and expecting families, the types of eligible families receiving services, funding sources, and gaps in early childhood home visitation, including community identification.
